\q2 he will receive all the penalties brought on by the curses against us for the wrong things we have done.
\q1

Although he will never have done any wrong or deceived anyone,
\q2 people will place his corpse where wicked people are buried, and in a rich man's grave.
\q1

But it will be Yahweh's will that he be afflicted and caused to suffer. When he dies as an offering for your own sin, 
\q2 he will benefit many, many people, as if they were his children;
\q2 he will live a long time after he dies and becomes alive again,
\q2 and he will accomplish everything that Yahweh has planned.
\q2

When he sees all that he will accomplish because of his suffering,
\q1 he will be satisfied.
\q2 And because of what will have happened to him, Yahweh's righteous servant, 
\q1 he will cause the guilt of many people to be ended,
\q2 because he will bear the guilt for their sins.
\q1

So Yahweh will share with many people the spoils he has won from his enemies. 
\q2 His servant will be like a king who divides the spoils among his soldiers,
\q1 because he put himself in danger of dying and did in fact die.
\q2 Even though people had considered him to be a sinner,
\q1 he removed the guilt of many people,
\q2 and he interceded for those who have done things that are wrong.

Yahweh says, "You people of Jerusalem, start to sing!
\q2 You who are like women who have never given birth to children, sing loudly and shout joyfully,
\q1 because you, who are like childless women who have been abandoned by their husbands, will soon have more children
\q2 than women who have never had any children.
\q1

Make your tents larger;
\q2 make them wider,
\q2 and fasten them firmly with tent pegs.
\q1

You will need to make your city much larger
\q2 because soon you and your descendants will spread all over the land.
\q1 They will force the people of other nations to leave where they are,
\q2 and you will live again in the cities that people had previously abandoned.
\b
\q1

Do not be afraid; you will no longer be ashamed.
\q1 Previously you were ashamed because your enemies conquered you
\q2 and caused your nation to be like a widow,
\q1 but soon you will not even remember that.
\q1

I, Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, the Holy One of Israel, who rules over the whole earth,
\q1 the one who created you,
\q2 will be like a husband to you.
\q1

Your nation was like a woman whose husband left her,
\q2 and caused you to be very sad;
\q1 you were like a young woman who
\q1 got married when she was very young,
\q2 and then her husband abandoned her.
\q1

I abandoned you people of Jerusalem for a while,
\q2 but now I am saying, 'I will take you back.'
\q1

I was very angry with you for a while,
\q2 and I turned away from you.
\q1 But I will act mercifully toward you
\q2 and I will faithfully love you forever.
\q2 That is what I, Yahweh, your rescuer, say to you.
\b
\q1

During the time that Noah lived,
\q2 I solemnly promised that I would never again allow a flood to cover the earth.
\q1 So now I solemnly promise that I will not be angry with you again and rebuke you.
\q1

Even if the mountains and hills shake and collapse,
\q2 I will not stop faithfully loving you,
\q1 and I will not cancel my covenant
\q2 to cause things to go well for you.
\q2 That is what I, Yahweh, who acts mercifully, say.
\b
\q1

You people of Jerusalem, your enemies acted very violently toward you;
\q2 it was as though your city had been battered by a severe storm,
\q2 and no one helped you.
\q1 But now I will cause your city to be rebuilt with stones made of turquoise,
\q2 and will cause the foundations of the city to be made of sapphires.
\q1

I will cause the towers on the city wall to be made of rubies,
\q2 and all the gates and outer walls of the city will be made of other very valuable stones.
\q1

I will be the one who will teach you people
\q2 and cause things to go well with you.
\q1

If any army attacks you,
\q2 it will not be because I have incited them to do that,
\q1 and you will defeat anyone who attacks you.
\b
\q1

Think about this:
\q2 Blacksmiths fan the coals to make a very hot flame
\q2 in order to produce weapons that can be used in battles,
\q1 but I am the one who has produced blacksmiths!
\q1 And I am also the one who created people who destroy other people and cities.
\q1

You will not be defeated by soldiers using weapons
\q2 that they have made to attack you,
\q1 and when others try to accuse you, you will prove that they are wrong, and you will condemn them to punishment.
\q2 That is the reward for the people who serve Yahweh.
\q1 I will defend them and show everyone else that they are right to trust me;
\q2 that is what I, Yahweh, promise."

"Come here! All you people who are in exile,
\q2 and listen to me!
\q1 If you are thirsty,
\q2 now is the time for you to come to me and get your water!
\q1 Now those who had no money,
\q2 you can come and buy wine and milk from me, the finest wine and the best milk!
\q1 You can get what you need from me,
\q2 and you can buy it now! 
\q1 You can buy it even though you do not have any money, 
\q2 and even though you could never afford it!
\q1

Why do you spend money to buy things that do not supply what you really need?
\q1 Why do you work hard to get money to buy things that do not truly satisfy you?
\q1 Pay attention to what I say
\q2 and acquire what is really good!
\q1 If you come to me, then in your heart you will truly be happy.
\q1

Listen to me and come to me;
\q2 pay attention to me, and if you do that, you will have new life within you.
\q1 I will make a covenant with you that will last forever
\q2 to faithfully love you like my love for King David.
\q1

And similarly, you will summon people of other nations to come to you,
\q1 nations that previously you have not heard about,
\q2 and they had not heard about you;
\q1 and they will come to you quickly
\q2 because they will have heard that I, Yahweh, your God, the Holy One of Israel, have honored you.
\q1

Wicked people should abandon their wicked behavior,
\q2 and evil people should stop thinking what is evil.
\q1 They should turn to Yahweh,
\q2 and if they do that, he will act mercifully toward them;
\q1 they should turn to Yahweh, their God,
\q2 because he will fully pardon them for all the wicked things that they have done.
\q1

Yahweh declares that what he thinks is not the same as what you think,
\q2 and what he does is very different from what you do.
\q1

Just as you people on the earth can never reach the sky,
\q2 in the same way, what Yahweh does you can never understand, although you may understand the things you do;
\q1 and what Yahweh thinks you can never understand, although you may understand what you think.
\q1

Yahweh sends the rain and snow down from the sky,
\q2 and they water the ground.
\q1 When the ground becomes moist, it causes plants to sprout and grow,
\q2 with the result that the soil produces seed for the farmer to plant and grain to produce flour to make bread for people to eat.
\q1

And similarly, the things that I promise to do, I will always cause to happen;
\q2 my promises will always come true.
\q1 They will accomplish the things for which I spoke them.
\q1

This is why you will leave Babylon joyfully;
\q2 you will have peace as Yahweh leads you out.
\q1 It will be as though the hills and mountains sang joyfully,
\q2 and the trees in the fields clapped their hands.
\q1

Instead of thornbushes and briers,
\q2 pine trees and myrtle trees will grow in your land.
\q1 As a result of that, people will honor Yahweh much more;
\q2 and what Yahweh does will cause everyone to remember what he has promised, and they will honor him."

Yahweh says to all the people of Judah,
\q1 "Do the things that are fair and right,
\q2 because I will soon come to rescue you; I will soon show everyone that you have been right to trust me.
\q1

I will bless those who faithfully obey my laws about the Sabbath days.
\q1 I will bless those who keep sacred my Sabbath days,
\q2 and who do not do any work on those days,
\q2 and who refrain from doing anything that is evil.
\b
\q1

Foreigners who have believed in me should not say,
\q2 'Yahweh will surely not allow me to belong to his people.'
\q1 And eunuchs should not say,
\q2 'Because I am deformed and unable to have children, I cannot belong to Yahweh;
\q2 I am like a tree that has completely withered.'
\q1

They should not say that, because I, Yahweh, say this to the eunuchs
\q2 who obey my laws about the Sabbath,
\q1 and who choose to do the things that please me,
\q2 and who obey all the other laws of the covenant that I made with the Israelite people:
\q1

I will also bless those who are not Israelites
\q2 who join themselves to me,
\q1 who serve me and worship and love me,
\q2 who obey my laws about the Sabbath,
\q1 and who faithfully obey all the other laws of the covenant that I made with the Israelite people.
\q1

I will bring them to my sacred hill in Jerusalem,
\q2 and cause them to be very joyful in my temple where people pray to me,
\q1 and I will accept the sacrifices that they burn on my altar and other sacrifices that they offer,
\q2 because my temple will be a building where people of all nations pray to me.
\q1

I, Yahweh, the Lord, the one who will bring back the people of Israel who have been forced to go to other countries, say this:
\q I will bring from other countries many more people to join those Israelites whom I have brought back."
\q1

The Israelite leaders should be like watchdogs to protect the people,
\q2 but it is as though they were blind.
\q1 They understand nothing.
\q2 They are all like dogs that cannot bark.
\q1 Good watchdogs bark when strangers approach,
\q2 but the Israelite leaders do not warn the people that their enemies are coming.
\q1 Instead, they just want to lie down and sleep and dream.
\q1

And they are like greedy dogs;
\q2 they never get all that they want.
\q1 They are supposed to lead the people, like good shepherds lead their flocks,
\q2 but they are ignorant,
\q2 and they each do whatever they want to do.
\q1

They say to each other, 'Come, let us go and get some wine and other alcoholic drinks,
\q2 and let us become drunk!
\q1 And tomorrow we will enjoy drinking even more!'"

Righteous people die,
\q2 and no one is concerned about it.
\q1 Godly people die,
\q2 and no one understands why.
\q1 God takes them away in order that they will not endure more calamities,
\q2

and now they have peace.
\q1 They lived righteously,
\q2 and now they rest peacefully in their graves.
\b
\q1

Yahweh says, "But you who practice sorcery, come here!
\q2 You who worship idols,
\q2 listen to me!
\q1

Do you realize whom you are ridiculing,
\q2 and whom you are insulting?
\q2 Do you realize to whom you are sticking out your tongues?
\q1 You are insulting me, Yahweh!
\q2 You are always rebelling against me and always lying, just like your ancestors.
\q1

You are eager to sleep together under every tall green tree where you worship your gods.
\q1 You kill your children as sacrifices to your idols in the dry riverbeds,
\q2 and offer them as sacrifices to your idols in the rocky caves.
\q1

You take big smooth stones from the riverbeds
\q2 and worship them as your gods.
\q1 You pour out wine to be an offering to them,
\q2 and you bring grain to burn for an offering to them.
\q1 Do you think that I enjoy all those things?
\q1

You sleep with idols' prostitutes on every hill and mountain,
\q2 and you go there to offer sacrifices to your gods.
\q1

You have put charms behind your doors and doorposts,
\q2 and you have deserted me.
\q1 You have taken off your clothes 
\q2 and climbed into your bed,
\q1 and invited more of your lovers to come to bed with you.
\q1 You have paid them to sleep with you,
\q2 and you have looked at their private parts.
\q1

You have given fragrant oil and lots of perfume to kings,
\q2 and you sent representatives to distant countries to look for other gods to worship;
\q1 you even tried to send messengers to the place of the dead to search for new gods.
\q1

You became weary because of doing all those things,
\q2 but you never said, 'It is useless for us to do that.'
\q1 You found new strength for worshiping idols,
\q2 so you continued to do so.
\b
\q1

Was it because you were afraid of those idols more than you were afraid of me that you lied about what you were doing,
\q2 and you do not even think about me?
\q1 Was it because I did not punish you for a long time that you are not afraid of me ?
\q1

You think that the things that you have done are right,
\q2 but I will tell you the truth:
\q1 It will not help you to do any of those things.
\q1

When you cry out for help to your collection of idols,
\q2 they will not rescue you.
\q1 The wind will blow them away; a single breath will carry them all away.
\q2 But those who trust in me will live in the land of Israel,
\q1 and they will worship me on Zion, my sacred hill."

Yahweh will say, "Prepare yourselves to receive me,
\q2 like people build and prepare a road for a king to come on.
\q1 Get rid of the things that are causing you to sin.
\q1

Because this is what I say—I, Yahweh, who am holy and honored more than anyone else, and who live forever:
\q1 I live in the highest heaven, where everything is holy,
\q2 but I also am with those who are humble and who are sorry for the sinful things that they have done.
\q1 I will greatly encourage those who have repented.
\q1

I was angry with my people because they sinned by taking with force what belonged to others.
\q2 Because I was angry, I punished them and turned away from them,
\q2 but they continued sinning.
\q1

I have seen the evil things that they continually do,
\q2 but I will restore them and lead them.
\q1 I will encourage them.
\q2 As for those who are mourning,
\q2

I will enable them to sing songs to praise me.
\q1 I will restore all my people, those who live near Jerusalem and those who live far away,
\q2 and I will cause things to go well for them.
\q1
and I, Yahweh, say that things will never go well for those who are evil."

Yahweh said to me,
\q1 "Shout loudly!
\q2 Shout like a loud trumpet!
\q1 Shout to warn my Israelite people about their sins!
\q1

They worship me every day;
\q2 they come to my temple because they say that they are eager to know what I want them to do.
\q1 They act as though they were a nation that does things that are righteous,
\q2 that would never abandon the commands of me, their God.
\q1 They request me to decide matters justly,
\q2 and they are eager that I should come to them.
\q1

They say, 'We have fasted to please you,
\q2 but you did not notice our doing that.
\q1 We humbled ourselves,
\q2 but you did not pay any attention!'
\b
\q1 I will tell you why I did not pay attention.
\q2 It is because when you fast,
\q1 you do it only to please yourselves,
\q2 and you act cruelly toward all your workers.
\q1

You fast, but you also quarrel and fight with each other with your fists.
\q2 Doing things like that while you fast will certainly not cause me to hear your prayers where I am, high in heaven.
\q1

You bow your heads
\q2 like the tops of reeds bend when the wind blows,
\q1 and you wear rough clothes and cover your heads with ashes like people do when they are grieving.
\q1 That is what you do when you are fasting,
\q2 but do you really think that will please me?
\b
\q1

No, that is not the kind of fasting that I desire.
\q1 Instead you should seek to free those who have been unjustly put in prison,
\q2 and encourage those who are treated cruelly;
\q2 and free those who have been oppressed in any way.
\q1

Share your food with those who are hungry
\q2 and to allow those who have no houses to stay in your houses.
\q1 Give clothes to those who do not have clothes,
\q2 and do not hide yourself from your relatives who need help from you.
\q1

If you do those things,
\q1 what you do for others will be like a light that shines when it dawns.
\q2 The troubles that have been caused by your sins will end quickly.
\q1 Others will know about your righteous behavior,
\q2 and the glorious presence of Yahweh will protect you from behind
\q2 like I protected the Israelite people when they left Egypt.
\q1

Then you will call out to me,
\q2 and I will quickly answer and say, 'I am here to help you.'
\b
\q1 Stop oppressing people;
\q2 stop falsely accusing people;
\q2 and stop saying evil things about people.
\q1

Give food to those who are hungry,
\q2 and give to people who are afflicted the things that they need.
\q1 Your doing that will be like a light that shines in the darkness;
\q2 instead of doing evil to people, the good things you do for people will be like the sunshine at noontime.
\q1

Yahweh will guide you continually,
\q2 and he will give you good things to satisfy you.
\q2 He will enable you to remain strong and healthy.
\q1 You will be like a garden that is well watered,
\q2 like a spring that never dries up.
\q1

Your people will rebuild the cities that were destroyed long ago;
\q2 they will build houses on top of the old foundations.
\q1 People will say that you are the ones who are repairing the holes in the city walls,
\q2 and who are repairing the streets where people live.
\b
\q1

Do not travel on the Sabbath days,
\q2 and on Sabbath days do not do only the things that you delight to do.
\q1 Enjoy the Sabbath days, and consider them to be delightful.
\q2 The Sabbath days are my holy days.
\q2 Honor me, Yahweh, in everything that you do on the Sabbath days.
\q1 Do not talk about and do things to please yourselves.
\q2 If you do all the things that I have just now told you to do,
\q1

I will enable you to be joyful.
\q2 I will greatly honor you;
\q1 it will be as though you were riding with me above the highest mountains!
\q2 I will give to you the blessings that I gave to your ancestor Jacob.
\q1 Those things will surely happen because I, Yahweh, have said it."

Listen to this! Yahweh's power is not too little to rescue you.
\q2 He has not become deaf; he can still hear you when you call to him for help.
\q1

But you have separated yourselves from your God by the sins that you have committed.
\q1 Because of your sins, he has turned away from you,
\q2 with the result that he does not pay attention to what you request him to do.
\q1

You do violent things to others,
\q2 with the result that your hands are stained with their blood.
\q1 You constantly tell lies,
\q2 and you say evil things about others.
\q1

When you accuse someone in court, what you say is not fair and it is not true.
\q2 You accuse people falsely; you depend on the lies you tell.
\q1 You are constantly planning to cause trouble for others,
\q2 and then you do those evil things that you planned.
\q1

What you plan to do to harm people is like the eggs a poisonous snake lays, like a web that a spider catches its victims in.
\q2 Cobras will hatch from those eggs,
\q2 and insects will fall into the spider's web.
\q1

You cannot hide the evil deeds that you have done.
\q1 You are constantly acting violently.
\q1

You are very quick to go and do evil deeds,
\q2 and you hurry to murder people who are innocent.
\q1 You are continually thinking about sinning.
\q2 Wherever you go, you destroy things and cause people to suffer.
\q1

You do not know how to act peacefully or to treat others fairly.
\q1 You always are dishonest,
\q2 and those who imitate your behavior never have any peace within themselves.
\b
\q1

Because of that, God does not rescue us from our enemies,
\q2 it seems that he is not acting fairly toward us.
\q1 We expect God to give us light,
\q2 but all he gives us is darkness.
\q1

We are like blind people who have to feel along the wall to be able to walk anywhere.
\q2 We stumble and trip at noontime like we would when it is dark.
\q1 We are like dead people who are among healthy people.
\q1

We growl like hungry bears;
\q2 we continually moan like doves.
\q1 We ask God to do what is just,
\q2 but nothing happens.
\q1 We want God to rescue us,
\q2 but it seems that he is far away.
\b
\q1

But these things are happening because it is as though our sins are piled high in the presence of God,
\q2 and it is they that testify against us.
\q1 We cannot deny it;
\q2 we know that we have done many wrong things.
\q1

We know that we have rebelled against Yahweh;
\q2 we have turned away from him.
\q1 We oppress people by what we testify against them;
\q2 we do not allow them to get what they have a right to get.
\q1 We think about the lies that we can tell,
\q2 and then we tell them.
\q1

No one tells the truth,
\q2 and people try to ruin the reputations of those who quit doing evil.
\b
\q1 Yahweh looked around, and he saw that no one was doing what is just;
\q2 he was very displeased.
\q1

He was disgusted when he saw that no one tried to help those who were being treated cruelly.
\q2 So he used his own power to rescue them;
\q1 it is because he is always righteous that he did that.
\q1

It is as though he were a soldier who put on his armor and a helmet;
\q2 his continually doing what is right is like his armor, and his ability to rescue people is like his helmet.
\q1 His being extremely angry and his being ready to get revenge on those who do evil are like his robes.
\q1

He will repay his enemies for the evil things that they have done.
\q2 He will severely punish even those who live far from Jerusalem.
\q1

When that happens, people everywhere, from the east to the west, will respect and honor Yahweh,
\q2 because he will come like a rushing river that is pushed along by the strong wind that Yahweh sent.
\b
\q1

And Yahweh says that he will come to Jerusalem to free his people;
\q2 he will come to rescue those in Judah who have stopped doing sinful things.

This is what Yahweh says to his people: "This is the covenant that I will make with you: My Spirit will not leave you, and you will always have my message. You will be able to declare it, and your children and grandchildren will be able to declare it forever."

You people of Jerusalem, stand up!
\q2 Yahweh has done glorious things for you,
\q1 and he has acted powerfully for you;
\q2 so show others that he is very great!
\q1

But spiritual darkness has covered all the other people groups on the earth,
\q2 complete darkness,
\q1 but Yahweh will show you how great he is,
\q2 and other people will also see it.
\q1

People of all people groups will see that he is very great by seeing what he has done for you,
\q2 and kings will come to see the wonderful things that have happened to you.
\b
\q1

Yahweh says, "Look around, and you will see the people who will be returning from exile!
\q1 Your sons will come from distant countries;
\q2 others will carry your little daughters home.
\q1

When you look at this happening,
\q2 you will be very joyful in your inner beings,
\q1 because people will bring valuable goods to you from all around the world.
\q2 They will bring valuable things from many nations in ships.
\q1

People will also bring valuable goods to you on herds of camels:
\q2 camels from the Midian and Ephah areas of northern Arabia.
\q1 And from Sheba in southern Arabia they will come, bringing gold and frankincense;
\q2 they will all come to praise me, Yahweh.
\q1

They will bring flocks of sheep and goats from Kedar in northern Arabia and give them to you.
\q2 They will bring rams from Nebaioth for you to sacrifice on my altars,
\q1 and I will accept them happily.
\q2 At that time I will cause my temple to be very beautifully decorated.
\b
\q1

And what are those things that are
\q2 moving swiftly like clouds?
\q1 They resemble pigeons returning to their nests.
\q1

But they are really ships from Tarshish that are bringing your people back here.
\q2 When your people come, they will bring with them all the valuable possessions that they have acquired,
\q1 and they will do that to honor me, Yahweh, your God, the Holy One of Israel,
\q2 because I will have greatly honored you.
\b
\q1

Foreigners will come and rebuild the walls of your cities,
\q2 and their kings will serve you.
\q2 Although I punished you because I was angry with you,
\q2 these things will happen now because I will act mercifully toward you because I am kind.
\q1

The gates of your cities will be open during the day and also during the night,
\q2 in order that people will be able to bring into your cities valuable things from many countries,
\q2 with their kings being led to you in the processions.
\q1

And the kingdoms and nations whose people refuse to allow you to rule them will be completely destroyed.
\q1

The glorious things in Lebanon will be brought to you—
\q2 lumber from cypress trees and fir trees and pine trees—
\q1 to be used to make my temple beautiful.
\q2 When that is done, my temple will truly be glorious!
\q1

The descendants of those who oppressed you will come and bow down to you;
\q2 those who despised you will prostrate themselves in front of your feet.
\q1 They will say that your city on Mount Zion
\q2 is the City of Yahweh,
\q2 where the Holy One of Israel lives.
\b
\q1

Previously everyone hated you and ignored you,
\q2 but now your city will be majestic forever;
\q1 and I will cause you to be joyful forever.
\q1

People of all nations and their kings will gladly bring their wealth to you.
\q1 When that happens, you will realize that I truly am Yahweh,
\q2 the one who saves you and rescues you from your enemies,
\q2 and that I am the mighty one to whom you Israelite people belong.
\q1

Instead of metals that are not valuable, like bronze and iron,
\q2 I will bring to you silver and gold.
\q1 Instead of wood and stones,
\q2 I will bring you bronze and iron for your buildings.
\q1 There will be peace in your country,
\q2 and your rulers will do what is fair.
\q1

People in your country will no longer act violently,
\q2 and people will no longer destroy your land and drive you out of it.
\q1 The people in the city will be safe,
\q2 and everyone there will praise me.
\b
\q1

And you will no longer need the sun and moon to give you light,
\q2 because I, Yahweh, will give you more light than the sun and moon;
\q1 I will be a glorious light for you forever.
\q1

It will seem as though the sun and moon will always be shining,
\q2 because I, Yahweh, will be an everlasting light for you.
\q1 You will never again be sad because of things that happen to you.
\q1

Your people will all be righteous,
\q2 and they will occupy the land forever,
\q1 because I myself have put you there like people plant trees 
\q2 in order that you will show others that I am very great.
\q1

At that time, the groups that are very small now will become very large clans,
\q2 and small clans will become great nations.
\q1 All those things will happen because, I, Yahweh, will cause them to happen at the right time."

The Spirit of Yahweh our Lord is on me;
\q2 he has appointed me to bring good news to those who are oppressed,
\q1 to comfort those who are discouraged,
\q2 and to free all those who are as though they are chained by the wrong things that they continually do.
\q1

He has sent me to tell those who mourn 
\q2 that now is the time when Yahweh will act kindly toward his people;
\q1 now is the time when our God will get revenge on their enemies.
\q1

To all those in Jerusalem who mourn,
\q1 he will give beautiful things to wear on their heads
\q2 instead of ashes that they put on their heads to show that they were sad;
\q1 he will cause them to rejoice instead of being sad;
\q2 he will enable them to be happy instead of being discouraged.
\q1 They will be called 'people who continually do what is right,
\q2 people who are like tall oak trees that Yahweh has planted'
\q1 to show others that he is very great.
\b
\q1

Those who return from Babylon will rebuild the cities that the soldiers from Babylon tore down.
\q2 Even though those cities have been destroyed and abandoned for many years,
\q1 they will be restored.
\q1

Foreigners will be the ones who will take care of your flocks of sheep and goats,
\q2 and plow your fields and take care of your grapevines.
\q1

But you are the ones who will be like the priests to serve Yahweh,
\q2 to work for God.
\q1 You will enjoy valuable goods that are brought from other nations,
\q2 and you will be happy that those things have become yours.
\q1

Previously you were shamed and disgraced,
\q2 but now you will have great blessings;
\q1 previously your enemies humbled you,
\q2 but now you will have many good things;
\q1 you will be happy because you will be in your land again,
\q2 and you will rejoice forever.
\b
\q1

"I, Yahweh, am very pleased with those who decide matters fairly;
\q2 I hate those who illegally take things from other people.
\q1 I will surely repay my people
\q2 for all that they have suffered in the past.
\q1 And I will make an everlasting agreement with them.
\q1

Their descendants will be honored by people of other nations; their children will be honored by all the other nations.
\q2 Everyone who sees them will know that they are a nation that I, Yahweh, have blessed."
\b
\q1

I greatly rejoice because of what Yahweh has done!
\q2 I am happy in all my inner being,
\q1 because he has saved me and declared that I am righteous;
\q2 those blessings are like a robe that he has put on me.
\q1 I am as happy as a bridegroom in his wedding clothes,
\q2 or a bride wearing jewels.
\q1

Just as seeds sown in a garden sprout from the soil and grow,
\q2 Yahweh our God will cause people of all nations to act righteously,
\q1 with the result that they will praise him for doing that.

Because I am very concerned about the people of Jerusalem,
\q2 I will do something to help them.
\q1 I will not stop praying for them
\q2 until they are rescued from their oppressors,
\q1 until that becomes as apparent to everyone as the dawn every morning,
\q2 until people can see it as clearly as they see a torch shining brightly at night.
\b
\q1

Some day the people of many nations will know that Yahweh has rescued you, his people.
\q2 Their kings will see that your city is very great.
\q1 And Yahweh will give your city a new name.
\q1

It will be as though Yahweh had held you up in his hands in order that everyone can see you.
\q2 Under his authority you will be like a crown worn by a king.
\q1

Your city will never again be called 'the deserted city,' and your country will never again be called 'the desolate land';
\q2 it will be called 'the land that Yahweh delights in,'
\q2 and it will also be called 'married to Yahweh.'
\q1 It will be called that because Yahweh will be delighted with you,
\q2 and it will be as though you were his bride.
\q1

You people will live in all the country of Judah
\q2 like a young man lives with his bride.
\q1 And our God will be happy that you belong to him,
\q2 like a bridegroom is happy that his bride belongs to him.
\q1

You people of Jerusalem, I have placed watchmen on your walls;
\q2 they will earnestly pray to Yahweh day and night.
\q1 You watchmen, you must not stop praying
\q2 and reminding Yahweh about what he has promised to do.
\q1

And tell Yahweh that he should not rest
\q2 until he causes Jerusalem to be a city that is famous and admired throughout the world.
\b
\q1

Yahweh has raised his right hand to solemnly promise to the people of Jerusalem:
\q2 "I will use my power and will never again allow your enemies to defeat you;
\q1 soldiers from other nations will never come again to take away your grain
\q2 and the wine that you worked hard to produce.
\q1

You yourselves will grow the grain,
\q2 and you will be the ones who will praise me, Yahweh, while you eat the bread made from the grain.
\q1 Inside the courtyards of my temple,
\q2 you yourselves will drink the wine made from the grapes that you harvested."
\b
\q1

Go out through the city gates!
\q2 Prepare the highway on which people will return from other countries!
\q1 Cause the road to become smooth;
\q2 clear off all the stones;
\q1 set up signal flags to help the people groups to see the road to Jerusalem.
\b
\q1

This is the message that Yahweh has sent to the people of every nation:
\q2 "Tell the people of Israel, 'The one who will rescue you is coming!
\q1 Look! He will be bringing to you your reward;
\q2 those whom he has rescued will be going ahead of him.'"
\q1

They will be called 'Yahweh's own people,'
\q2 'the ones whom he rescued.'
\q1 And Jerusalem will be known as the city that Yahweh loves,
\q2 the city that is no longer abandoned.

I ask, "Who is this who is coming from the city of Bozrah in Edom,
\q2 whose clothes are stained red from blood?
\q1 Who is this who is wearing beautiful robes?"
\q2 He replies, "It is I, Yahweh, declaring that I have defeated your enemies,
\q1 and I am able to rescue you!"
\b
\q1

I ask him, "What are those red spots on your clothes?
\q2 It appears that you have been treading on grapes to make wine."
\b
\q1

He replies, "I have been treading on my enemies, not on grapes.
\q2 I did it myself; no one helped me.
\q1 I punished them because I was very angry with them,
\q2 and my clothes became stained with their blood.
\q1

I searched for someone who would enable me to help my people,
\q2 but I was amazed that there was no one to help me.
\q1 So I defeated their enemies with my own power;
\q2 I was able to do that because I was very angry.
\q1

Because I was extremely angry, I punished the nations;
\q2 I caused them to stagger like drunk men,
\q1 and I caused their blood to pour out on the ground."
\q1

I will tell about all the things that Yahweh has done for his people because of his faithful love for them,
\q2 and I will praise him for all that he has done.
\q1 Yahweh has done good things for us people of Israel;
\q2 he has acted mercifully toward us
\q2 and he has steadfastly and faithfully loved us.
\q1

When we had many troubles,
\q2 he was sad also.
\q1 He sent his angel from before his presence to rescue us.
\q2 Because he loved us and was merciful to us,
\q2 he saved us;
\q2 it was as though he had picked our ancestors up and carried them all those years during which they were oppressed in Egypt.
\q1

But we rebelled against him,
\q2 and we caused his Holy Spirit to be sad.
\q1 So he became like an enemy
\q2 who fought against us.
\b
\q1

Then we thought about what happened long ago,
\q2 during the time when Moses led our ancestors out of Egypt.
\q1 We cried out, "Where is the one who brought our ancestors through the Sea of Reeds
\q2 while Moses led them?
\q1 Where is the one who sent his Holy Spirit
\q2 to be among our ancestors?
\q1

Where is the one who showed his glorious power
\q2 and caused the water to separate when Moses lifted his arm above it,
\q1 with the result that he will be honored forever?
\q1

Where is the one who led our ancestors while they walked through the seabed?
\q2 They were like horses that were racing along and never stumbled.
\q1

They were like cattle that walk down into a valley to rest,
\q2 and the Spirit of Yahweh enabled them to go to a place where they could rest.
\q1 Yahweh, you led your people,
\q2 and you caused yourself to be praised."
\q1

"Yahweh, look down from heaven;
\q2 look down on us from your holy and glorious home.
\q1 You were previously very concerned about us, and you acted powerfully to help us.
\q2 But it seems that you do not act mercifully and zealously for us anymore.
\q1

You are our father, even if
\q2 Abraham does not know what is happening to us,
\q2 and Jacob is not concerned about us, either,
\q1 but Yahweh, you are our father;
\q2 you rescued us long ago.
\q1

Yahweh, why did you cause us to wander away from your road?
\q2 Why did you cause us to be stubborn in our inner beings,
\q2 with the result that we no longer honor you?
\q1 Help us like you did previously,
\q2 because we are the people who serve you and belong to you.
\q1

We, your holy people, possessed your sacred temple for only a short time,
\q2 and now our enemies have destroyed it.
\q1

Now it seems as though we never were ruled by you,
\q2 as though we never belonged to you."

It would have been like fire burning up dead wood,
\q2 or like fire making water to boil.
\q1 Come down in order that your enemies will know who you are,
\q2 and so that the people of other nations will tremble in your presence.
\q1

You help those who joyfully do what is right,
\q2 those who conduct their lives as you want them to.
\q1 But we did not do that; we continued to sin,
\q2 and so you became angry with us.
\q1 We have been sinning for a long time.
\q2 It is only if we continually do what you want us to do that you will save us.
\q1

We have all become people who are not fit to worship you;
\q2 all of the good things that we have done are only like bloodstained rags.
\q1 Because of our sins, we are all like leaves that dry up
\q2 and are blown away by the wind.
\q1

None of our people worships you,
\q2 and no one really tries to persuade you to help him.
\q1 You have turned away from us.
\q2 It is as though you have abandoned us, so that we keep sinning and become more and more guilty.
\q1

But even so, Yahweh, you are our father.
\q2 We are like clay that a potter uses,
\q2 and you created us, like a potter creates pottery.
\q1

Yahweh, do not continue to be angry with us;
\q2 do not keep thinking about our sins forever.
\q1 Do not forget that we are all your people.
\q1

Your glorious temple on Mountain Zion, where our ancestors worshiped you,
\q2 has been completely burned up.
\q2 And all our other beautiful things have been ruined.
\q1

Yahweh, you see all those things, but it seems that you refuse to do anything to help us.
\q2 It seems that you will cause us to suffer much more."

This is what Yahweh said:
\q1 "I was ready to reply to my people,
\q2 but no one requested me to help them.
\q1 I was ready to help even those who did not call out to me.
\q2 I continued to say, 'I am here to help you!'
\q1

It is as though I had continually held out my arms to show that I was ready to help my people who rebelled against me,
\q2 and who continually did the evil things that they wanted to do.
\q1

They boldly continue to do things that cause me to be angry:
\q2 they offer sacrifices to their idols in their gardens,
\q1 and they burn incense to them on altars made of bricks and tiles.
\q1

They remain awake at night in cemeteries,
\q2 talking with the spirits of dead people.
\q1 They eat the meat of pigs,
\q2 and their pots are full of the broth of meat that is unacceptable to me.
\q1

Then they say to others,
\q2 'Stay away from me; do not come near me,
\q1 because I am very holy,
\q2 with the result that you should not touch me.'
\q1 People like that are like smoke in my nose
\q2 from a fire that burns continually.
\q1

I have written a record of all the evil things that they have done.
\q2 And I will not remain silent about all those things;
\q1 I will certainly punish these people
\q2

for the sins that they and their ancestors have committed.
\q1 They have mocked me by burning incense to their idols on the hilltops.
\q2 So I will punish them like they deserve for doing those things."

This is also what Yahweh said:
\q1 "When there is a cluster of nice grapes on a vine,
\q1 people do not throw them away,
\q2 because they know that there is good juice in those grapes.
\q1 Similarly, because there are some people in Judah who faithfully serve me,
\q2 I will not get rid of all of them.
\q1

I will spare some of the descendants of Jacob
\q2 who are living on the hills of Judah.
\q1 I have chosen them, and they will possess that land;
\q2 they will worship me, and they will live there.
\q1

Then all the land from the Plain of Sharon near the Mediterranean Sea and as far east as the Valley of Achor near Jericho will become pastureland,
\q2 where their cattle and sheep will rest.
\b
\q1

But it will be different for you who have abandoned me,
\q2 you who do not worship me on Zion, my sacred hill,
\q1 you who worship Gad and Meni, the gods who you say will bring you good luck and good fortune.
\q1

It is I, not Meni, who will decide what will happen to you;
\q2 you will all be slaughtered by swords.
\q1 That will happen because you did not answer
\q2 when I called out to you.
\q1 I spoke to you,
\q2 but you did not pay attention.
\q1 Instead, you did things that I said are evil;
\q2 you chose to do things that do not please me.
\q1

I, Yahweh the Lord, will give to those who worship and obey me things to eat and drink,
\q2 and they will be happy;
\q1 but all you evil people will be hungry and thirsty,
\q2 and you will be sad and disgraced.
\q1

Those who worship and obey me will sing joyfully,
\q but you evil people will wail loudly
\q2 because you will be suffering in your inner beings.
\q1

Those whom I have chosen will use your names when they curse people;
\q1 I, Yahweh the Lord, will get rid of you.
\q2 But I will give to those who worship and obey me a new name.
\q1

The people in this land have had many troubles,
\q2 but I will cause those troubles to occur no more.
\q1 Therefore those who request me to bless them and those who solemnly promise to do something
\q2 should never forget that I am God, who faithfully do what I promise to do.
\q1

Note this: Some day I will create a new heaven and a new earth.
\q2 They will be very wonderful, with the result that you will no longer think about all the troubles you had previously.
\q1

Be glad and always rejoice because of what I will do:
\q2 Jerusalem will be a place where people rejoice;
\q2 the people who live there will always be happy.
\q1

I will rejoice about Jerusalem,
\q2 and I will be delighted with my people.
\q1 People will no longer weep or cry because of being distressed.
\b
\q1

My people will build houses and then live in them.
\q2 They will plant vineyards and then eat grapes from those vineyards.
\q1

The houses that they build, no one will take those houses away from them and live in them.
\q2 No one will take a vineyard away from its owner.
\q1 My chosen people will live a long time, like trees do,
\q2 and they will enjoy the things that they have done—
\q1 the houses that they have built and the crops that they have planted.
\q1

They will not work hard in vain,
\q2 and their children will not die from some calamity.
\q1 I will certainly bless their children and their grandchildren.
\q1

No one will be harmed or injured anywhere on Zion, my sacred hill:
\q1 wolves and lambs will eat grass together peacefully;
\q2 lions will eat hay like oxen do, and they will not attack people.
\q2 Snakes will not hurt anyone; they will lie on the ground and eat only dirt.
\q1 That is surely what it will be like because I, Yahweh, have said it."

Yahweh also said this:
\q1 "All of heaven is like my throne,
\q2 and the whole earth is like my footstool.
\q1 So you could certainly not build a house
\q2 that would be adequate for me to live in and rest!
\q1

I have created everything;
\q2 all things exist because I made them.
\q1 That is true because I, Yahweh, have said it.
\b
\q1 The people I am most pleased with are those who are humble,
\q2 who patiently endure it when they suffer,
\q2 and who tremble when they hear me rebuking them.
\q1

You have chosen to continually do the things that you want to do:
\q1 some of you slaughter oxen to sacrifice them to me,
\q2 but you also bring human sacrifices to your idols!
\q1 You sacrifice lambs to me,
\q2 but you kill dogs to offer them to your gods.
\q1 You offer grain to me,
\q2 but you also bring pigs' blood to your idols.
\q1 You burn incense to me,
\q2 but you also praise your idols.
\q1 You delight to do those disgusting things.
\q1

When I called out to you,
\q2 you did not answer.
\q1 When I spoke, you did not pay attention.
\q1 You did many things that I say are evil,
\q2 and you chose to do things that I did not like.
\q1 So now I will punish you by causing you to experience the things that you yourselves have done, that you yourselves are afraid of."
\q1

But you people who tremble when you hear what Yahweh says,
\q2 listen to what he says now:
\q1 "Some of your people hate you and drive you away
\q2 because you belong to me.
\q1 They make fun of you, and they say,
\q2 'Yahweh should show his glorious power!
\q2 We want to see him do something to cause you to be truly happy.'
\q1 But some day those people will be very disgraced."
\q1

At that time, you will listen to the noise in the city.
\q2 You will hear the shouting in the temple.
\q1 It will be the sound of Yahweh paying back his enemies.
\q1

No one ever heard that a woman gave birth to a baby
\q2 when she was just starting to have birth pains.
\q1

Certainly no one ever heard about such a thing happening,
\q2 and no one has ever seen it happen.
\q1 Similarly, no one ever heard that a nation was created in one instant,
\q2 not in one day.
\q1 But Jerusalem is like a woman who gives birth to children
\q2 as soon as she starts to have birth pains.
\q1

Women certainly do not bring infants to the time when they are ready to be born and then do not allow them to be born.
\q2 Similarly, Yahweh will do for Jerusalem what he has promised to do:
\q1 he will cause Jerusalem to be full of people again.
\q2 That will happen because Yahweh has said it.
\q1

You people in Jerusalem, rejoice!
\q2 And all you people who love Jerusalem should also be happy.
\q1 You people who were sad because of what happened to Jerusalem,
\q2 you should now be glad.
\q1

You people in Jerusalem will have everything that you need,
\q2 like a baby that gets all it needs from its mother's breasts.
\q1 You will enjoy all the abundant and glorious things in the city.

Yahweh has promised,
\q1 "I will cause Jerusalem to be full of valuable things that come from other nations;
\q2 those things will pour into Jerusalem; it will be like a big flood.
\q1 I will take care of the people of Jerusalem
\q2 like women care for the babies that they nurse.
\q1

I will comfort you people in Jerusalem like mothers comfort their children."
\b
\q1

When you see those things happen,
\q2 you will rejoice.
\q1 Your old bones will become strong again
\q2 like in the springtime, when the grass grows.
\q1 When that happens, everyone will know that Yahweh has power to help those who worship and obey him,
\q2 but that he is angry with his enemies.
\q1

Yahweh will come down with flames of fire,
\q2 and his chariots will come down like a whirlwind;
\q1 he will be extremely angry,
\q2 and he will punish his enemies by burning them in a fire.
\q1

It is as though Yahweh had a big sword,
\q2 and he will judge and execute many people.
\b

Yahweh says, "Some of you will prepare yourselves to enter the garden of idols by washings and special diets and clothing, and you follow into that place, those who eat the meat of pigs and mice, and other things that I have forbidden you to eat. I promise you, I will stop them and they will not do this any more!"
I know all the evil things that they all think and do. It is now time for me to gather together the people who live in all nations and who speak all languages, and to show them that I am very great.

I will do something among them to show everyone who they are, and those whom I have spared will go to various distant countries: To Tarshish, Put, Lud (home of archers), Meshech, Tubal, Javan, and to distant islands. I will send them to proclaim to nations that have never heard about me that I am very great and glorious.

Then they will bring back here your relatives who have been exiled, like the offerings that my Israelite people used to bring in the correct manner to the temple. They will travel to Jerusalem, where my holy mountain is; they will come on horses and in chariots, in wagons, on mules and on camels.

I solemnly promise that I will appoint some of them to be priests, and others to do other work in my temple. That will surely happen because I, Yahweh, have said it.
\b
I also promise that just like the new heaven and the new earth will last forever, you will always have descendants, and you will always be honored.
At every festival to celebrate the Sabbath each week and the new moon each month, everyone will come and worship me. That will surely happen because I, Yahweh, have said it.

Then they will go out of Jerusalem and look at the corpses of those who rebelled against me. The maggots in those corpses will never die, the fire will never stop burning them, and everyone who sees their corpses will detest them."
